medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe shortness of breath, especially at rest.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began worsening in the patient's 40s, with increasing shortness of breath and more frequent lung infections. Initially, the patient experienced a productive cough after developing pneumonia in college but did not feel limited by cystic fibrosis until later in life. Prior to treatment, the patient experienced shortness of breath for the first time, causing significant anxiety.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cystic fibrosis, diagnosed at age 3 after recurrent pneumonia and symptoms of fat malabsorption in infancy. History of recurrent sinus infections and severe sinusitis requiring surgery later in life.
medical_history.family_history: Parents were told the patient was unlikely to live past the age of 7 due to cystic fibrosis. No other specific family medical history mentioned.
medical_history.social_history: Married, worked as an engineer for the last 23 years in Virginia. No specific lifestyle factors or habits mentioned.
